name: Brendon Hartley
introduction: Brendon Hartley (born 10 November, 1989) is a New Zealand born professional racing driver and two time FIA World Endurance Championship Champion.[1] After serving as a test driver for ToroRosso and Red Bull in his early twenties as part of the Red Bull Young Driver programme, Hartley's Formula One dream was all but over in 2012 after he lost his Red Bull funding to get into the top tier of motorsport. The Kiwi would subsequently complete simulator work for Mercedes, but was overlooked for a race seat after the 2012 Young Driver Test at Magny-Cours.[2]
